column4: help anyone i am using ubuntu and when i go to network now i cant see other computers on my network but i can still acces them if i type smb://IP_ADDRESS
- what are the other pcs? and are they in the same workgroup as you?
yep other computers in my workgroup they are all running windows
- is the ubuntu box in the same workgroup?
yep
- what are the other machines? xp? ubuntu? etc
mine is ubuntu the other 7 are xp
yep
- can you browse the workgroup from other xp machines
yep
it is only the ubuntu machine which does not show the other computers i have to access them via ip addresses
- i do windows network engineering for a living so i understand whats going on - just dont understand why you cant browse the workgroup
wow, but i can browse it via ip addresses though.
the names are gone
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=278992
thanks but somehow is it possible to get my system the way it was
- by following whats written in the page
- smb/cifs runs over tcpip
well thanks again.
what is a WINS Server?
- not really used anymore because of advances in DNS - but its netbios stuff and you aint using netbios
thanks once more
